A couple blocks from my house there is a campsite called "The Pines". It was beautiful.
Then one crazy warm winter, a swarm of pine beetles, so dense it was visible to radar, flew over the Rocky Mountains and spent the next few years decimating virtually every mature pine tree in the region.
But don't you dare blame it on climate change. The fact we have spent the past century burning coal and oil releasing gigatons of co2 that was sequestered over a hundred million year period, has nothing to do with what is happening with the climate today. Everyone knows it's all a big lie.
"They" made it all up so they could charge us a few extra bucks for gas or something.

perhaps "mountain" pine beetle is a terrible example. It used to be only found in the COLDEST areas of it domain, high up mountains. Would global warming really help this species?
What the beetle needs for survival is old trees (well pines over 30 years of age) which, because of historical frequent lightening fires, used to only found in deep canyons near the mountain tops. With fire control and fighting this age group of pines are now found everywhere, ergo the population explosion.

pholotic magmas are viscous because of a high silicate composition. Silicates have a much lower melting point than iron, hence the pasty nature. Viscous magma (and in particular felsic magma) has a tendency to trap air bubbles which releases under substantial pressures producing these "Lava Bombs".

Also: In magma H2O is considered as a volatile fluid that can reduce the melting point of most rock.

3:02 I’ve been there, it’s a lake called Lake Tahoe. This picture doesn’t do it much justice, but the water is so clear you can see down about 30 feet (maybe more, I don’t really remember). It’s also a few miles across and about 20 miles long. It’s made completely of snow melt from the Sierra Nevada mountains above it. It’s in the middle of the desert but the water is freezing. It’s really high above sea level, too. It’s in between some mountains above Reno. It’s super cool.

I love SciShow, but I've never been a fan of these compilations. I watch every video you guys put out, so none of this is new to me. It strikes me as lazy - I know that fresh videos take longer, but rather than recycling old materials, I'd rather wait longer for new stuff. Even if these comps are necessary, the transitions between videos could be more fluid to make if feel less like you guys just searched through the file cabinet and haphazardly glued whatever you found onto a poster board and more like a proper video. Like I said, I love SciShow. Just don't do these comps. It's truly my one sticking point on this channel.
